SENT.plain: Paroxysmal nocturnal haemoglobinuria (PNH) is associated with anaemia, intravascular haemolysis and venous thrombosis
Cerebral venous sinus thrombosis (CVST) is a late but serious complication of PNH
We for the first time report a young man who presented with CVST and was diagnosed to have PNH after 11 months
We highlight the reasons for delay in the diagnosis and discuss the special issues in the management
